intro: Corydalis geyeri, commonly known as the Sierra crocus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Corydalis geyeri is a perennial herb that blooms in early spring, making it a notable wildflower in its native habitat.
